js
Class Static<T>

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      js.Var<T>
          js.Static<T>

public final class Static<T>
extends Var<T>

An opaque class helping to create Java static final references for Java applets.

This opaque class is especially helpful when used together with the opaque class Field to make Java static final references to the fields of JavaScript global objects which requires refresh-on-reload and late-evaluation in JS applets or other JS Embed Simulations.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
See Also:
Field
JavaScript:
Opaque types can be resolved but no class objects for them can be generated into the target codes. Re-compilers must exit with error on the operations of accessing that kind of class objects.

Constructor Detail

Static

public Static(Var<T> var)

Creates a refresh-on-reload static reference of an opaque variable.

Parameters:
var - The opaque variable to create the refresh-on-reload static reference for.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must ignore this constructor, that is, replacing it with its only argument.
Method Detail

var

public final T var()

Evaluates the current refresh-on-reload static reference, loading it if it is not loaded.

Specified by:
var in class Var<T>
Returns:
The value of the current instance itself.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must ignore the virtual invocation of this method, that is, replacing it with its current instance.
